summaryText: In a powerful sermon about perseverance, Pastor Travis Hearn delivers an electrifying message centered around the phrase 'Whatever It Takes'! Drawing inspiration from UFC fighter Tracy Cortez's incredible weight-cutting story, PT challenges us to fight for our faith, our marriages, our dreams, and our freedom. He shares deeply personal stories about his own struggles, including a brain bleed that left his right side numb, to illustrate that life's battles aren't about being perfect, but about refusing to quit. The sermon is a rallying cry for believers to develop an unshakable determination, maintain an eternal perspective, and surround themselves with the right people. Just like Tracy cutting her hair to make weight, we must be willing to do whatever it takes to pursue God's purpose for our lives. PT reminds us that our challenges don't define us - our response to them does. Whether you're fighting addiction, a failing marriage, or a health crisis, this message screams: KEEP FIGHTING! The devil may try to derail you, but with God in your corner, you are UNDEFEATED!
mainPoints: Get the right people in your corner

versesMentioned.text: Do you not know that in a race all the runners run, but only one gets the prize? Run in such a way as to get the prize. Everyone who competes in the games goes into strict training. They do it to get a crown that will not last, but we do it to get a crown that will last forever. Therefore I do not run like someone running aimlessly; I do not fight like a boxer beating the air.
I have fought the good fight, I have finished the race, I have kept the faith.

For my thoughts are not your thoughts, neither are your ways my ways, declares the Lord. As the heavens are higher than the earth, so are my ways higher than your ways and my thoughts than your thoughts.
We are hard pressed on every side, but not crushed; perplexed, but not in despair; persecuted, but not abandoned; struck down, but not destroyed.
But seek first his kingdom and his righteousness, and all these things will be given to you as well.
The Lord is with me; I will not be afraid. What can mere mortals do to me?

Monday.scripture: Philippians 4:13: 'I can do all this through him who gives me strength.'
Monday.action: Make a list of current challenges. Next to each challenge, write how God might be using this situation to grow your faith or develop your character.
Monday.prayer: Lord, help me see beyond my current circumstances. Give me Your perspective and help me trust that You are working all things together for my good. Renew my mind and strengthen my faith. Amen.

Tuesday.scripture: James 1:2-4: 'Consider it pure joy, my brothers and sisters, whenever you face trials of many kinds, because you know that the testing of your faith produces perseverance.'
Tuesday.action: Identify one area where you've been tempted to give up. Write a commitment statement declaring your intention to keep fighting, no matter what.
Tuesday.prayer: God, give me the strength to persevere. Help me dig deep and find the courage to keep moving forward, knowing that You are with me in every battle. Strengthen my resolve and fill me with Your power. Amen.

Wednesday.scripture: Proverbs 13:20: 'Walk with the wise and become wise, for a companion of fools suffers harm.'
Wednesday.focus: Surrounding yourself with the right people
Wednesday.action: Evaluate your inner circle. Identify relationships that drain your spiritual energy and those that uplift and challenge you to grow. Consider having an honest conversation or setting new boundaries.
Wednesday.prayer: Lord, guide me in choosing companions who will push me closer to You. Help me be discerning about who I allow to speak into my life. Fill my circle with people who love You and want to see me succeed. Amen.

Thursday.scripture: Psalm 34:18: 'The Lord is close to the brokenhearted and saves those who are crushed in spirit.'
Thursday.action: Share your current struggle with a trusted friend or mentor. Ask them to pray with and for you, and be open to receiving support and guidance.
Thursday.prayer: Father, teach me the strength found in vulnerability. Help me not to isolate myself during difficult times, but to lean on the support of my community and ultimately on You. Give me courage to be honest about my journey. Amen.

Friday.scripture: Romans 8:28: 'And we know that in all things God works for the good of those who love him, who have been called according to his purpose.'
Friday.action: Reflect on a past challenge that seemed impossible at the time. Journal about how God worked through that situation and what you learned.
Friday.prayer: God, remind me of Your faithfulness. Help me trust that even when I can't see the way forward, You are working all things together for my good. Increase my faith and help me rest in Your promises. Amen.

Saturday.scripture: Ephesians 6:10: 'Finally, be strong in the Lord and in his mighty power.'
Saturday.action: Create a personal 'battle strategy' for an ongoing challenge. List practical steps, scripture promises, and prayer points to help you stay focused and motivated.
Saturday.prayer: Lord, clothe me in Your strength. Prepare me for the battles ahead and help me remember that with You, I am more than a conqueror. Fill me with courage, determination, and unwavering faith. Amen.
